isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - STEERING COLUMN ASSEMBLY, TILT - 9600, 9700, 9800 - ASSEMBLE - UNIVERSAL JOINTS

step1.para: Make certain the parts are clean before re-assembly.
Place the yoke on a hard surface and with a soft hammer, tap one bearing part way into the yoke ( Figure 23). Be sure that the bearing is started straight into the yoke.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Install the Bearing Part Way Into the Yoke

step1.para: Insert the spider through the opposite open hole, swinging it into place and down into the partially installed bearing.
Turn the assembly over and tap the opposite bearing part-way into the yoke. Be certain to start the bearing straight into the yoke.
Place the yoke in a vise with the bearings against the jaws of the vise. Tighten the vise slowly and the bearings will be pressed into the yoke ( Figure 24).

After pressing the bearings into the yoke, the spider may be off center in the yoke. This is desirable because it permits installation of the snap ring on the side with the most clearance ( Figure 25). Install the ap ring.

After the first ring is in place, turn the assembly over. The bearing with the snap ring installed should be on the bottom. Rest the yoke on a vise and strike the bearing on top with a soft hammer. This should seat both bearings with the installed snap ring against the inside milled surface of the yoke. Install the remaining snap ring.
Lubricate the universal joint with Fleetrite EP2 Moly grease or equivalent NLGI #2 Multi-purpose lithium grease.
